metadata.title: CVE-2022-4904 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the c-ares package. The ares_set_sortlist is missing checks about the validity of the input string, which allows a possible arbitrary length stack overflow. This issue may cause a denial of service or a limited impact on confidentiality and integrity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libc-ares2 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: c-ares package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu0.22.10.1').
